result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua S. Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 10:10 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF302 and 22CF207. 

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears via zoom, and with Attorney Natasha VanLieshout.  

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
22CF207 --
Ct.1(Strangulation and Suffocation/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Battery/Domestic Abuse)>>DRI.
REMOVE Domestic Abuse enhancer on Ct.3;

22CF302 --
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Operate w/o valid license (2nd w/in 3 years))>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
22CF207 --
Ct.3(DC)>>GUILTY.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis.

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 1 year for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct.3;

DEOJ RH set for 8/21/2023 at 9:00 am.
Bond continues.


Adj: 10:20 am.

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 11:58 am.
INCLUDES: 22CF207 and 22CF302.
State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears via zoom, and by Attorney Natasha VanLieshout via zoom. 
VRCW. 

Parties have reached an agreement but need more time for DEOJ paperwork. 

Plea/Sentencing set for 8/26 at 10:00 am.
Parties are able to appear via zoom. 

Adj: 12:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 18, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Final pre-trial on August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases Called at 2:30 pm.
INCLUDES: 22CF207 and 22CF302. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears, pro se. 
VRCW. 

Defendant used to be represented by Attorney Peterson, and now SPD is looking for new Counsel. 

NEXT DATE:
FPT/TPD set for 8/31 at 9:30 am. 
Adj: 2:32 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Becca. 
Case Called: 9:42 am. 
***UNMONITORED DAR*** 
BRANCH 5 CASE.

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for ADA Cody Marschall.
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

VRCW. Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: 
Signature Bond in the amount of $500.00.

 CONDITIONS: 
- No driving w/o valid license.
- Prints and photograph. 

DATES:
FPT: 06/08/2022 @ 2:30 pm. (also prelim at this time).

Adjourned: 9:45 am.
